user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_get_timeout64s:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN int64_t
MHD_get_timeout64s (struct MHD_Daemon *daemon)
{
  uint64_t utimeout;
  if (MHD_NO == MHD_get_timeout64 (daemon, &utimeout))
    return -1;
  if (INT64_MAX < utimeout)
    return INT64_MAX;

  return (int64_t) utimeout;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
return (int64_t) utimeout;
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The final return statement is reachable when MHD_get_timeout64(daemon, &utimeout) returns success (not MHD_NO) and utimeout <= INT64_MAX; in that case control falls through the earlier tests and executes return (int64_t) utimeout;
